title: Aguero penalty gives Man City 2-1 ECL win
content:
Sergio Aguero scored a last-minute penalty to give Manchester City a 2-1 victory at Borussia Moenchengladbach as the English side got the first win of their Champions League campaign on Wednesday.

Aguero was fouled by United States defender Fabian Johnson in the 89th minute and sent 'Gladbach keeper Yann Sommer the wrong way for the visitors' first win.

Both sides lost their opening games in Group D.

Lars Stindl opened the scoring in the 54th minute for the home side who were playing European Cup football at home for the first time in 37 years.

But Nicolas Otamendi equalised with a deflected effort after Martin Demichelis' initial attempts were hooked out by a defender.
